Discussions.Discussion_Name: Zoom-link and time for next session on Thursday

Messages.Author: Henrike Knappe
Messages.Content: Dear students, as we meet online this week, I am sending you the zoom link for our session this week. We will use this link for next week (last session) as well. Please note that we need to start a bit later this Thursday, at 10:45 a.m., as there is a minor scheduling conflict this week. See you on Thursday and all the best, Henrike https://tu-berlin.zoom.us/j/8604992908?pwd=WGkyVFF3c0tvNThaQlhFbjZqQUZ4Zz09 Kenncode: 171293 Meeting-ID: 860 499 2908 P.S. We are still struggling with the ISIS system to provide you with individual feedback and grades for the essays. I am confident that we will get the problem solved by Thursday.

Discussions.Discussion_Name: Task for next week and teaching evaluation

Messages.Author: Henrike Knappe
Messages.Content: Dear all, please find the task for next week on ISIS. It is a preparatory task for your essay, due by Tuesday night. We will work with your task results then in the next session to develop your essay question further. Also, those who weren't there yesterday: Please be so kind and fill in the teaching evaluation for the first half of the module. The QR code is in the slides and we will discuss your feedback in the last session of the semester then. Also, keep in mind that the last two sessions of the semester will be online. All the best, Henrike

Discussions.Discussion_Name: essay questions and next session's presentations

Messages.Author: Henrike Knappe
Messages.Content: Dear all, Mehrab has set up an ether pad on ISIS, where you can write down your essay questions and any other questions that came up while searching for a topic/question for your first essay. We can use this as a digital feedback platform until we meet again next week. I will look into the Ether pad and comment/answer questions this Wednesday afternoon around 2pm and again next Monday afternoon around 2pm. For our next session on May 16th, we will need to fit in both sessions' topics. All students who were supposed to present last week, will then present on May 16th. Thus, this is the list of presentations for next week: -          Game theories: Prisoner’s dilemma and tragedy of the commons (Timo V.) -          Design of common- pool resource institutions (Elinor Ostrom) (Feline) -          The major groups in the SDG negotiations  (Timo H.) -          The role of the High Level Political Forum (Anssi) See you all next week, all the best, Henrike

Messages.Author: Henrike Knappe
Messages.Content: Dear all, Unfortunately, the class has to be canceled tomorrow due to illness. This is also a bit unfortunate as next week there will also be no class due to the national holiday. But we will set up a digital forum so that you get support with your essay writing. Please use the time tomorrow to develop your essay questions. All the best, Henrike

Messages.Author: Henrike Knappe
Messages.Content: Dear participants of the module "Global Environmental Governance", this is a friendly reminder that the first task (part of the oral participation part of the portfolio exam) is due Tuesday night. The tasks that you need to upload on ISIS every other week are part of the portfolio exam and thus mandatory. You find all info of the current task on ISIS including the template that you should use. For the students giving presentations: please send me your preliminary slides or a preliminary structure of your presentation by Wednesday noon the latest. If you have specific questions about the presentation you can of course always contact me earlier. The slides from last week are uploaded on ISIS. See you on Thursday! best, Henrike

Messages.Author: Henrike Knappe
Messages.Content: Dear all, for the MTS registration by tomorrow: you need to register for the exam of the module #61468 Global Environmental Governance. If there are any problems, let me and Mehrab know. All the best, Henrike

Discussions.Discussion_Name: Start of the module "Global Environmental Governance" and participation list

Messages.Author: Henrike Knappe
Messages.Content: Dear all, the preliminary list of students who have sucessfully registered for the module "Global Environmental Governance" is now online in the ISIS course. Please check the list and let us know in case you do not want to participate anymore and also if you are not on the list and want to be included in the waiting list. In both cases please send an email to me (henrike.knappe@tu-berlin.de) and our tutor Mehrab: mehrab-e-ahmad@campus.tu-berlin.de We will start the semester on Thursday, 10:15 am in room EB 416 with an introductory session. If you want to participate in the module, you need to attend this introductory session. If you are absent and not excused, we will give another student your spot in the course. I am looking forward to seeing you on Thursday! All the best, Henrike
